intro: Seseli montanum var. multicaule, commonly known as mountain sesame, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems that are often branched and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with numerous small, lance-shaped leaflets. Seseli montanum var. multicaule is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
